snippet: Suggestions for the new bureau include improvements to force-placed insurance, which banks buy at a price that is almost always higher than the market rate.
abstract: Paul Sullivan Wealth Matters column urges the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to regulate mortgage lenders' ability to force borrowers to take out excessive hazard, flood or wind insurance at above-market prices.
lead_paragraph: Suggestions for the new bureau include improvements to force-placed insurance, which banks buy at a price that is almost always higher than the market rate.

headline.print_headline: A To-Do List for the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau
headline.seo: Requests for Consumer Financial Protection Bureau
headline.main: A To-Do List for the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau
